div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 69 Peloponnesus, 1954 Burial: c. 350-325 B.C. (T) Contents: 25 AR Locri Opuntii: 2 triob. (as BMC 9-13 [1]; 42-4 [1]) Histiaea: 2 tetrob. (as BMC 26) Aegina: 1 st. (tortoise, as BMC pl. 24, 12) 1 dr. (as BMC pl. 25, 7) Sicyon: 10 triob. Pellene: 1 triob. (as BMC pl. 6, 10) Elis: 2 triob. (as BMC pl. 13, 9) Argos: 1 dr. (BMC pl. 27, 12; same obv. die) Megalopolis: 2 triob. (var. of BMC pl. 32, 11) Mantineia: 1 triob. (as BMC pl. 35, 1) Pheneus: 1 dr. (var. BMC pl. 36, 8) Tegea: 1 triob. (as BMC pl. 37, 11) Disposition: New York 4 (Sicyon, Elis, Argos, Pheneus); photos of remaining 21 coins on file in ANS Information from S. P. Noe
